Class View

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.awt.Component
        |
        +--java.awt.Canvas
              |
              +--View
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.io.Serializable
public class View
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.awt.event.MouseMotionListener, java.awt.event.MouseListener

This class defines the viewport. It indirectly handles the redrawing of the scene, and such things. This implementation uses a back buffer to make the animation move more smoothly.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

View

public View(Scene s,
            WinDesc w,
            java.awt.Image b,
            Info i)
Creates a new viewport.
Parameters:
s - The scene to draw to screen.
w - The size of the viewport.
b - The back buffer.
i - The textarea to write status info to.
